result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth X. Matelski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth X. Matelski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth X. Matelski was found guilty of UnemployComp-Fraud to Obtain Benefits, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 108.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay or CV Judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth X. Matelski

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Kenneth X. Matelski, appeared with Attorney Douglas Ivan Henderson.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 -DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs & surcharge and is due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Kenneth X. Matelski, appeared with Attorney Douglas Ivan Henderson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Henderson states he received a new offer from the State since DE paid his restitution in full and requests another date for a plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 09:20 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared specially for Attorney Drees for the State. Defendant, Kenneth X. Matelski, appeared with Attorney Douglas Ivan Henderson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Henderson states DE is close to paying off the restitution and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 09:40 am.
